scalf.project2

Class Torus

  • java.lang.Object
    • scalf.project2.Shape
      • scalf.project2.ThreeDimensionalShape
        • scalf.project2.Torus

  • public class Torus
extends ThreeDimensionalShape
    Provides calculations related to Tori.

    This is a revised version of Torus.

    Changes

    06 SEP 2020

    • Changed calls to validateInput(String) to getInput(String).
    • Added import for javax.swing.JOptionPane.
    • Modified calculate() to display a JOptionPane for errors instead of displaying the message in the console.

    Filename: Torus.java

    Author:
    Samuel Scalf
    Date:
    19 AUG 2020

    06 SEP 2020

    • Field Detail

      • minorRadius

        double minorRadius
        The distance from the center of a slice to any point along its circumference. A slice is cross-section of the torus and is equivalent to a circle.

      • majorRadius

        double majorRadius
        The distance from the center of the torus (in the "hole") to the center of a slice. The center of a slice can also be described as the halfway point between the inner and outer rings along a line drawn from the center of the torus.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Torus

        public Torus()
        Default Constructor. Simply calls the ThreeDimensionalShape constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • calculate

        public void calculate()
        Calculates the volume of a torus.
        Formula: V = (πr2)(2πR); r = Minor Radius, R = Major Radius

        NOTE: π is estimated to be 3.14159 for calculations. See Shape.PI.

        Specified by:
        calculate in class Shape
